meanings.definition: The quality or state of being heavy or dull.
meanings.sent1: The leadenness of the rock made it difficult to lift.
meanings.sent2: The leadenness of the sky indicated an approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The leadenness of the situation made everyone feel sleepy.
meanings.sent4: The leadenness of the silence weighed heavily on the room.
meanings.sent5: The leadenness of the atmosphere was suffocating.

meanings.definition: A feeling of heaviness or sluggishness.
meanings.sent1: After the big meal, a leadenness settled in his stomach.
meanings.sent2: The leadenness in her limbs made it hard to get out of bed.
meanings.sent3: The leadenness of Monday mornings always gets to me.
meanings.sent4: The leadenness of exhaustion weighed down his eyelids.
meanings.sent5: The leadenness of boredom hung in the air.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being oppressive or burdensome.
meanings.sent1: The leadenness of responsibility weighed on his shoulders.
meanings.sent2: The leadenness of debt loomed over their heads.
meanings.sent3: The leadenness of chores made her groan.
meanings.sent4: The leadenness of expectations crushed his spirit.
meanings.sent5: The leadenness of guilt consumed her thoughts.
